title: Graphic Designer / Cinematographer
description:
**About Us:**
Kerae Medical is a growing healthcare company dedicated to providing high\-quality durable medical equipment (DME) that enhances comfort, mobility, and quality of life. **Position Overview:**
We are looking for a creative and skilled Graphic Designer / Cinematographer to support our branding, marketing, and digital media projects. The ideal candidate has strong design skills, a good eye for visual storytelling, and technical knowledge in graphics rendering and video production. **Responsibilities:*** Design digital graphics, web visuals, and marketing materials aligned with Kere Medical’s brand.
* Capture and edit high\-quality photos and videos for promotional use.
* Create motion graphics, video intros, and animations for digital campaigns.
* Perform graphics rendering and ensure all visual outputs are optimized for various platforms.
* Collaborate with the marketing team on creative concepts, layouts, and visual storytelling.
* Maintain consistent visual branding across website, Amazon listings, and social media.

  

**Qualifications:*** Proven experience in graphic design and cinematography (portfolio required).
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, After Effects).
* Strong understanding of graphics rendering and video post\-production workflows.
* Experience with lighting, shooting, and editing professional\-quality videos.
* Excellent attention to detail and ability to manage multiple creative projects.

  

**Preferred Skills:*** Experience in product photography or healthcare media.
* Familiarity with website or e\-commerce visuals (Amazon, Shopify, or WordPress).
* Creative mindset with a passion for storytelling through visuals.

  

**Compensation:** Competitive pay based on experience.

title: Junior Graphic Designer
description:
**Dunlop Manufacturing, Inc.**, a fast\-growing manufacturer at the heart of the music industry—is looking for a **Junior Graphic Designer** to join our creative team in **Benicia, CA**. This role is perfect for a design\-driven creative who is ready to develop their skills while contributing to an established, iconic brands such as Tortex®, MXR®, Cry Baby®, Dunlop® and more. In this role you will be mentored and work closely and with the Production Artist, Senior Designer and Art Director. The ideal candidate has a strong portfolio showcasing branding, typography, layout, and color theory, with hands\-on experience across print and digital design.

* Support senior designer and art director on design projects
* Assist with the creation of digital assets for web, email, and social media
* Implement design changes across packaging systems
* Execute design revisions based on feedback
* Produce high\-quality physical comps for internal design reviews and executive presentations.
* Prepare files for print and digital production
* Photography re\-touch and edit support
* Maintain brand consistency across all deliverables
* Organize and manage design files and assets
* Participate in team meetings and collaborative creative sessions
* Research design trends, references, and inspiration
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams as needed
* Reports to Art Director

**Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design or related field
* 0–2 years of professional design experience
* Portfolio demonstrating a passion for design and strong fundamentals
* Basic understanding of branding, typography, layout, and color theory
* Experience creating print and digital work
* Familiarity with digital design formats (social media, email, web)
* Excellent craft with physical and digital design projects
* Willingness to learn and take direction
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
* Good written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects)
* Interest in design trends and visual culture
* Passion for guitar or music is a definite plus


Other

**For consideration, please provide a link to your digital portfolio.**

**Benefits**


We offer acompetitive hourly wage**,** commensurate with experience, ranging from $27\.00–$37\.00 per hour**.** Benefits include: Profit Sharing Plan, 401k Program, Medical, Dental, Vision Plan, Life Insurance, Long\-Term Disability Insurance, Paid Holidays, Vacation and Sick Leave.


Local San Francisco, Bay Area candidates are preferred.


Dunlop Manufacturing Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Senior Graphic Designer
description:
**Dunlop Manufacturing, Inc.**, a fast\-growing manufacturer at the heart of the music industry, is looking for a **Senior Graphic Designer** to join our creative team in **Benicia, CA**. In this role, you will be responsible for conceiving and developing the core creative ideas that fuel Dunlop’s global marketing. Your creativity will influence Dunlop’s brand perception as it applies to product lines such as Tortex®, MXR®, Cry Baby®, Dunlop® and more. You’ll work closely with the Art Director and supporting creative team to create award\-winning branding, packaging, print, environmental, POP, and digital design projects.  

  

In joining the Dunlop in\-house design team you will collaborate with iconic rock artists, past and present—including Jimi Hendrix, Metallica, Tool, Eddie Van Halen, Green Day, Iron Maiden, Jack White, Tom Morello and Slash. Our team also collaborates with outside agencies, illustrators, artists, and brands including Pendleton, Supreme, Shepard Fairey, John Van Hamersveld, ilovedust, and One Horse Town.

 **ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Serve as a lead creative contributor driving Dunlop’s marketing campaigns across print and digital
* Design award\-winning packaging for consumer electronic products and musical accessories
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to design and launch industry\-leading music products
* Work closely with Art Director and Creative Director to design electronic products for iconic rock artists, past and present
* Collaborate with the Creative Director and Art Director on title sequences for product demos, short films, and social media content
* Create presentations for executive leadership, as well as external artists and management teams
* Maintain and evolve brand consistency across Dunlop’s 2,000\+ product catalog
* Proactively research music industry trends, as well as broader design, photography, and visual culture trends
* Partner with world\-class external agencies, illustrators, artists and brand collaborators
* Oversee projects from concept through final execution, ensuring consistency, quality, and attention to detail
* Work closely with photographers, video editors, print and web production artists
* Mentor junior designers and share expertise to strengthen the overall creative team
* Participate in weekly project status meetings, marketing meetings, and collaborative creative sessions
* Role reports to the Art Director

 **Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in graphic design or related field
* 4–7\+ years of professional design experience in an agency or in\-house studio environment
* Strong portfolio demonstrating excellence in print, packaging, digital and motion design
* Demonstrates a mastery of branding, typography, layout, and color theory
* Proven experience in executing dynamic marketing campaigns in print and digital
* Wide understanding of printing techniques
* Solid understanding of point of purchase design principles
* Experience with trade show and exhibition design
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Receptive to feedback with the ability to iterate and refine creative work
* Exceptional time management, organizational skills, and attention to detail
* Advanced in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects)
* Passion for guitar or music is a definite plus


Other

**For consideration, please provide a link to your digital portfolio.**


Relocation assistance may be provided for qualified candidates

**Benefits**


We offer a competitive salary commensurate with experience, ranging from $85,000 to $100,000 annually. Benefits include: Profit Sharing Plan, 401k Program, Medical, Dental, Vision Plan, Life Insurance, Long\-Term Disability Insurance, Paid Holidays, Vacation and Sick Leave.


Dunlop Manufacturing Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Visual Designer - RTX Creative Team
description:
NVIDIA has been transforming computer graphics, PC gaming, and accelerated computing for more than 25 years. It’s a unique legacy of innovation that’s fueled by great technology—and amazing people.


Today, we’re tapping into the unlimited potential of AI to define the next era of computing. An era in which our GPU acts as the brains of computers, robots, and self\-driving cars that can understand the world. Doing what’s never been done before takes vision, innovation, and the world’s best talent. As an NVIDIAN, you’ll be immersed in a diverse, supportive environment where everyone is inspired to do their best work. Come join the team and see how you can make a lasting impact on the world!


Are you ready to craft the future of visual storytelling? At NVIDIA, we are redefining the boundaries of computer graphics, gaming, and AI. As a Visual Designer, you will be at the forefront of our creative journey, collaborating with a world\-class global team. This is an outstanding opportunity to bring your inventive ideas to life while collaborating with some of the most innovative individuals in the industry.

**What you'll be doing:**
-------------------------

* Collaborate with various roles to generate strategic and purposeful work for NVIDIA's GeForce and RTX PRO.
* Collaborate with teams in Marketing, Product, Event, Web, and PR to develop visual assets across all channels, social media, virtual experiences, websites, event marketing, and more.
* Work with teams from around the globe to make it all real from concept to final production.

**What we need to see:**
------------------------

* A BFA, BS, MFA in Graphic Design, or a similar degree, or equivalent experience in the creative field.
* 5\+ years of experience in visual design for global brands, including creation for product launches, promotional activities, and industry exhibitions.
* Impressive practical demonstrations illustrating your talent in imagining and implementing inventive artistic encounters through your proficiency in art direction, hands\-on creativity, and storytelling in 2D, 3D graphics, and video.
* Inflexible refinement and meticulous care coupled with the knack to streamline operations and uphold efficiency while exploring innovative frontiers.
* A background in proficient storytelling across various mediums – including 2D/graphic composition, 3D rendering motion graphics, video, photography.
* Outstanding communication skills – with the ability to simplify intricate concepts into clear, engaging narratives. You excel at presenting ideas, facilitating creative discussions, and adjusting promptly to real\-time feedback.
* Having a robust team\-oriented attitude, skilled at collaborating with diverse creative groups and eagerly tackling any required assignment to reach goals.
* Proficiency in fundamental design principles across art direction, typography, video, photography, and 3D, and an ability to implement brand systems in practical projects.
* A passion for working agile and in non\-linear workflows, with a keen interest in exploring new technologies and trends from the inside out.


Please provide a PDF or online portfolio showcasing 5\-10 build samples, which will be requested during the interview process.


Widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers, NVIDIA offers highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package. As you plan your future, see what we can offer to you and your family www.nvidiabenefits.com/


Your base salary will be determined based on your location, experience, and the pay of employees in similar positions. The base salary range is 100,000 USD \- 166,750 USD.
You will also be eligible for equity and benefits.


Applications for this job will be accepted at least until February 3, 2026\.
This posting is for an existing vacancy.


NVIDIA uses AI tools in its recruiting processes.


NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.
company_description: Bringing superhuman capabilities to some of the world's toughest problems.

title: Sales Presentation Specialist
description:
**Netradyne** harnesses the power of Computer Vision and Edge Computing to revolutionize the modern\-day transportation ecosystem. We are a leader in fleet safety solutions. With growth exceeding 4x year over year, our solution is quickly being recognized as a significant disruptive technology. Our team is growing, and we need forward\-thinking, uncompromising, competitive team members to continue to facilitate our growth.

**POSITION SUMMARY:**



Under the supervision of the Sales Enablement Director, the Strategic Sales Presentation Specialist is responsible for partnering with Account Executives on high\-stakes, late\-stage enterprise opportunities to build bespoke presentation decks that address specific client pain points and strategic goals.

  


**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**



To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily.


* Partner with Account Executives on high\-stakes, late\-stage enterprise opportunities to build bespoke presentation decks that address specific client pain points and strategic goals.
* Transform dense technical information, data, and SaaS workflows into intuitive infographics, clean diagrams, and emotionally resonant narratives.
* Own and maintain the master sales deck library with up\-to\-date, on\-brand templates and modules.
* Work closely with Product Marketing to translate new feature launches and roadmaps into digestable slide collateral.
* Act as the "Brand Police" for the sales organization, ensuring all external\-facing materials meet the high visual standards typical of a top\-tier creative agency.

  


**QUALIFICATIONS:**


* **The Enterprise Sales Cycle:** Deep familiarity with the stages of complex B2B sales (Discovery, Demo, Solutioning, Negotiation, Close) and the specific collateral needs at each stage.
* **Buyer Psychology \& Personas:** Understanding the distinct motivations and pain points of different stakeholders (e.g., the technical user vs. the C\-Suite financial buyer) and how to tailor messaging to each.
* **Objection Handling:** Knowledge of common sales objections (price, implementation time, competitor comparison) and how to visually structure arguments to preemptively address them.
* **Sales Methodologies:** Familiarity with common frameworks (like Challenger Sales, MEDDIC, or Consultative Selling) to align presentation flow with the sales team's approach.
* **Information Design Theory:** A strong theoretical grasp of how to simplify complex data. This includes knowledge of how to turn a dense technical architecture diagram into a digestible visual without losing accuracy.
* **Visual Hierarchy \& Cognitive Load:** Understanding how the human eye scans a slide. Knowledge of how to use whitespace, scale, and contrast to ensure a prospect focuses on the *value proposition*, not the decoration.
* **Brand Systems:** Practical knowledge of how to work within (and stretch) strict brand guidelines. This involves understanding typography, color theory, and master template construction.
* **Technical Proficiency:** Deep technical knowledge of presentation software (PowerPoint, Keynote, Google Slides) beyond the basics—including master slides, animation builds for storytelling, and file optimization—as well as design tools like Adobe Illustrator or Figma.
* S**torytelling Structures:** Knowledge of narrative arcs (e.g., "The Hero's Journey" or "Problem/Agitation/Solution") applied to a business context. They must know how to build tension and release it through the product solution.
* **Features vs. Benefits:** The theoretical understanding of marketing translation—knowing how to take a product "feature" (what it does) and translate it into a "benefit" (why it matters) visually.

  


**EDUCATION:**



Bachelor's degree required;

  


**Compensation Package\_Perks of being a Netradyne employee:**


* Salary \+ eligibility for yearly bonus
* Company equity
* Company Paid Health Care, Dental, and Vision Coverage for you and most of your dependents
* Generous PTO and Sick Leave
* 401(K) with generous company match
* Disability, Life Insurance and Ancillary Benefits
* And much more!

  

We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. Netradyne is an equal\-opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status, or any legally protected status.



If there is a match between your experiences/skills and the Company's needs, we will contact you directly.



Netradyne is an equal\-opportunity employer.


**Applicants only \- Recruiting agencies do not contact.**


**Recruitment Fraud Alert!**



There has been an increase in fraud that targets job seekers. Scammers may present themselves to job seekers as Netradyne employees or recruiters. Please be aware that Netradyne does not request sensitive personal data from applicants via text/instant message or any unsecured method; does not promise any advance payment for work equipment set\-up and does not use recruitment or job\-sourcing agencies that charge candidates an advance fee of any kind. Official communication about your application will only come from emails ending in '@netradyne.com' or '@us\-greenhouse\-mail.io'.



Please review and apply to our available job openings at Netradyne.com/company/careers. For more information on avoiding and reporting scams, please visit the Federal Trade Commission's job scams website.

title: Graphics Specialist (SF)
description:
**Overview**


The **Graphics Specialist** is a key member of the Graphics and Marketing team and works closely with consulting staff, the management team, and functional teams to develop high\-quality visual materials that support both internal and external initiatives. This role is responsible for creating original and enhanced PowerPoint graphics, ensuring brand consistency, and delivering timely creative support across the organization. The Graphics Specialist reports to the **Senior Manager, Graphics and Marketing** and collaborates with multiple internal teams to uphold Health Advances’ visual standards and communication quality.


**Key Responsibilities**


* **Presentation \& Visual Design**
	+ Design and produce compelling presentation deliverables for consulting teams
	+ Advise consultants on best practices for effective presentation graphics and visual storytelling
	+ Create illustrations, icons, and quantitative data visualizations using appropriate software tools
* **Brand \& Template Stewardship**
	+ Use and maintain presentation and document templates to uphold Health Advances’ corporate identity
	+ Ensure consistent application of visual standards in all internal and external communication materials
* **Production \& Workflow Support**
	+ Share in the production management of client deliverables and other projects
	+ Communicate timelines and set expectations for task and project completion to internal stakeholders
* **Marketing \& Web Support**
	+ Assist with updates to the Health Advances website and social media channels (e.g., LinkedIn, Facebook)
	+ Support the Marketing Team in the execution of digital and print marketing activities
* **Internal Knowledge \& Extranet Support**
	+ Assist case teams with posting interviewee materials to the firm’s Experts extranet platform
* **Ad Hoc Projects**
	+ Support cross\-functional and time\-sensitive initiatives as needed

**Qualifications**


* **Education \& Experience**
	+ A two\- or four\-year degree in graphic design, visual arts, or a related field — or equivalent professional experience
	+ 1\+ years of experience in a corporate environment; experience in professional services is preferred
* **Technical Skills**
	+ Strong PowerPoint skills (1\+ years of advanced use required)
	+ Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs
	+ Experience with Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and Acrobat
	+ Familiarity with website content management systems and basic web design tools; HTML/CSS or web\-coding experience is a plus
	+ Exposure to AI\-based design platforms preferred
* **Creative \& Professional Skills**
	+ Demonstrated creativity and strong graphic design capability
	+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	+ Strong organizational skills and precise attention to detail
	+ Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously
	+ Ability to work in a fast\-paced environment
	+ Respect for confidentiality
	+ Genuine interest in healthcare and the firm’s mission

**Work Expectations**


* Must reside in the **Boston area** and work onsite at the Newton, MA office \~2 days per week **OR** reside in the **Bay Area** and work onsite at the San Francisco, CA office \~2 days per week
* Full\-time role at **45 hours per week**
* Standard schedule: **Monday–Friday, 8:30am–5:30pm** (local time — ET for Newton, PT for San Francisco)
* Permanent US work authorization required


**Compensation \& Additional Information**


This position is based in Newton, MA or San Francisco, CA. Compensation is determined based on a range of factors including experience, skill set, training, certifications, and organizational needs.


* **Base salary range:** $60,000\-70,000 USD
* **Annual incentive eligibility:** Reasonable first\-year estimate ranging from $0\-4,200 USD (subject to program rules and performance factors)


Health Advances may work with third\-party service providers for recruiting, screening, and pre\-employment processes. By applying, candidates acknowledge that their information may be shared with such providers for recruiting\-related purposes.


Applicants in California: In accordance with the **San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance**, Health Advances will consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records.


*Health Advances provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*


*This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.*

title: Brand Designer
description:
**About Console**


Console builds AI agents that automate IT support directly in Slack, handling everything from password resets to onboarding so teams can focus on their core tasks.


We’re backed by Thrive Capital (investors in OpenAI, Stripe, GitHub), SV Angel, Jack Altman and other Tier 1 startup founders. Customers like Webflow, Ramp, and Cursor already use Console to automate up to 70% of IT requests.


We’re at an inflection point – strong product\-market fit, massive market, and an opportunity to define the next generation of internal automation.

**Why Join**

* Impact from day 1: You’ll own our brand identity.
* Autonomy: High\-agency environment. Ship fast, iterate faster, and own results end\-to\-end.
* Team: Ex\-founders and startup operators obsessed with solving hard problems.
* Upside: Competitive pay in the top 10% of early\-stage SF startups plus equity.

**The Role**


We’re hiring a Brand Designer to help shape and maintain Console’s brand as the company grows. This role sits at the center of how Console shows up in the world from foundational brand work to high\-visibility moments tied to launches, campaigns, and category creation.


You’ll work on marketing\-led brand initiatives that influence perception and drive growth. This role is ideal for a designer who cares about storytelling, thrives in high\-velocity environments, and wants to help shape a brand.

**What You’ll Do**

* Design high\-quality brand assets across web, campaigns, sales materials, events, social, and internal storytelling.
* Help evolve and expand Console’s brand system, maintaining consistency while exploring new, differentiated expressions.
* Translate brand strategy and messaging into clear, compelling visual work.
* Bring systems thinking and strong attention to detail to layouts, concepts, and executions.
* Iterate quickly across multiple workstreams, balancing speed with polish.
* Bring references, inspiration, and creative ideas that help Console stand out in a crowded AI landscape.
* Maintain a high bar for quality and coherence across all brand touchpoints.

**About You**

* 4–6 years of experience in brand design, visual design, or marketing\-focused creative roles.
* A portfolio that demonstrates strong visual taste, storytelling, and brand thinking.
* Proficient in Figma and Adobe Creative Suite; curious about AI\-assisted design tools and workflows.
* Experience designing for marketing materials (web, campaigns, decks, events, content).
* Comfortable working in fast\-moving environments with evolving priorities.
* Interested in technology and AI\-driven companies.


Compensation Range: $150K \- $200K
company_description: Console entered the property management market back in 1992, creating a trust accounting software that changed an entire industry.

title: Sign Detailer/Graphic Designer
description:
**Job Purpose**


We are seeking a talented and detail\-oriented Signage Detailer/Designer to support and help drive the AD/S brand. This role works collaboratively within a team of designers to develop conceptual, permit, and production drawings for clients nationwide. Projects include, but are not limited to, commercial pylon and monument signage, wayfinding programs, and other custom signage solutions.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* Develop clear, creative conceptual drawings based on client requirements and hand sketches
* Translate conceptual designs into accurate technical drawings
* Produce complete permit drawing sets for city and municipal planning approval, including required forms, schedules, and details
* Develop detailed production drawing sets for in\-house manufacturing
* Support the Design Department on large\-scale signage programs and multi\-site projects
* Collaborate cross\-functionally with internal teams to ensure design intent and production feasibility
* Maintain customer confidence by handling proprietary and confidential information appropriately
* Provide design expertise and problem\-solving solutions to customers
* Deliver high\-quality customer service with attention to accuracy and timelines

 **Skills \& Qualifications**

* Required: Proficiency in **CorelDRAW** (X6 or newer)
* Preferred: Experience with **SolidWorks**
* Strong organizational and time\-management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects under tight deadlines
* Ability to develop conceptual drawings from hand sketches
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Strong attention to detail and problem\-solving ability
* Positive attitude with persistence and a high level of integrity
* Ability to work independently while contributing effectively in a team environment
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word)
* Strong hand\-drawing skills for design development and conceptual design
* Working knowledge of SketchUp, Adobe Photoshop, and Adobe Illustrator
* Familiarity with AutoCAD
* Knowledge of industrial design and signage design principles
* Excellent visualization skills
* Ability to read and interpret architectural and technical drawings
* Strong understanding of layouts, dimensioning, and technical detailing

 **Education, Training \& Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent combination of education and experience
* 3–5 years of relevant professional design experience
* Experience in signage, engineering, or construction industries is a plus

 **Benefits**

* Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance
* Vacation and sick pay plus a floating holiday
* Paid holidays
* 401(k) with company matching after qualifying period
* Referral bonus program
* Employee discounts

 **Additional Information**


This job description is not intended to be all\-inclusive. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

 **Physical, Mental Demands \& Work Environment**

**Physical Demands**


Employees frequently sit, stand, and walk; communicate in person and by phone; and use hands and fingers repetitively to operate standard office equipment. Employees may occasionally lift and move materials weighing up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities include close vision and the ability to adjust focus.

**Mental Demands**


This position requires frequent use of written and oral communication skills; reading and interpreting technical information; analyzing and solving problems; performing highly detailed work; managing multiple concurrent tasks; working under deadlines; and interacting with managers, coworkers, vendors, and the public.

**Work Environment**


The work environment is typically an office setting with a generally quiet noise level. Some assignments may involve moderately noisy environments.

 **Equal Opportunity \& Compliance**


We are an **E\-Verify employer**. Background checks and drug testing are required as part of the hiring process.

title: Graphic Designer - Independent Contractor
description:
Are you an established Independent Contractor working with clients as a graphic designer, matching voice and branding as an expertise? If yes, read on...

 **About Us:**



The Shift Network empowers a global network of more than 2\.5 million people to live their full potential through the events, courses and programs that we offer, featuring leading wisdom keepers and visionaries from around the world. We invite you to explore our site for more information about the courses we offer and the faculty we feature, and to view our branding!

title: Production Designer, Print Design, Compendium, Crown Publishing Group (Open to Remote)
description:
Compendium is a Seattle\-based publishing company renowned for its children’s and inspirational books, journals, greeting cards, and gift products. Founded as an independent publisher 40 years ago, Compendium is now an imprint of Ten Speed Press, which is an imprint of Crown Publishing Group, a division within Penguin Random House. Compendium has built a reputation for creating thoughtful and uplifting content that celebrates life’s meaningful moments.


The Compendium mission is to connect people through meaningful moments with gifts that inspire. Our millions of joyful messages—found in greeting cards and children’s books, guided journals and customizable keepsakes—have touched the lives of people around the globe. Through their impact, we’ve discovered that a bit of inspiration can, in fact, make a big difference. We invite you to join us on our journey—to empower, delight, inspire, and care.


The Compendium design department seeks a highly creative print production designer to join remotely working west coast team. Production Designer works closely with the marketing, editorial and wholesale design departments. We are looking for a detail\-oriented and organized self\-starter invested in creating marketing materials for both print and online. We can offer all\-around tenacity and creativity in a busy and fast\-paced department. This position is geared toward a solutions\-focused creative.


**Specific responsibilities include:**

* Catalog creation: build bi\-annual printed catalog, including prepress and color checks at press. Manages proofing and printing schedule
* Asset creation: barcodes, flattened product JPGs, display photos and Photoshop: retouching, editing, and color correction. Assist on set up for Editorial photoshoot and processing/filing of images
* Organize and manage Product photoshoot, being based in Seattle region is a plus.
* Image formatting and organization/maintenance of Image Library
* Maintain schedules and meet deadlines on assigned projects
* Perform other related projects or duties as assigned or required
* Implement editorial text corrections to interior book pages and covers
* Prepare final production of book files for routing, FTP, and archiving
* Meet weekly with supervisor, design colleagues, and/or editorial staff to review work and address special issues in relation to completion of job

**Please apply if you meet the following qualifications:**

* A minimum of 3 years of experience working in print design
* Graphic design skills and computer/technical knowledge for catalog and book production
* Thorough knowledge of Adobe CC: InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator and Acrobat Pro
* Knowledge of working with style sheets, master pages, and creating templates in InDesign
* Knowledge of paragraph and character styles
* Knowledge of proofreader marks
* Working knowledge of MS Office programs: Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
* High attention to detail and precision
* Ability to organize, prioritize, multi\-task, and coordinate workload under pressure
* Great communication skills and willingness to ask questions
* Must be a team player and have the ability to work independently
* Candidates a commutable distance of Seattle, WA are a plus, but not required for consideration as the position is open to remote

**The salary for this position is $66,500** **.** **All positions are currently eligible for annual profit award or bonus, subject to Company results.**

**Please apply using our ATS system by February 19, 2026** **, and include your resume, cover letter, and marketing/book interior design portfolio as a link or PDF attached to your digital application for consideration. Before applying for any role at Penguin Random House, we recommend you review our** **applicant resources page** **and look over our hybrid and open\-to\-remote guidelines on our** **FAQs page.**

Penguin Random House job postings include a good faith compensation range for each open position. The salary range listed is specific to each particular open position and takes into account various factors including the specifics of the individual role, and candidate's relevant experience and qualifications.  



  

Full\-time employees are eligible for our comprehensive benefits program. Our range of benefits include, but are not limited to, Medical/Prescription drug insurance, Dental, Vision, Health Care/Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account, Pre\-Tax and Roth 401(k), Short and Long\-Term Disability Insurance, Life/AD\&D Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Student Loan Repayment Program, Educational Assistance \& generous paid time off.  



  

Penguin Random House is the leading adult and children's publishing house in North America, the United Kingdom and many other regions around the world. In publishing the best books in every genre and subject for all ages, we are committed to quality, excellence in execution, and innovation throughout the entire publishing process: editorial, design, marketing, publicity, sales, production, and distribution. Our vibrant and diverse international community of nearly 300 publishing brands and imprints include Ballantine Bantam Dell, Berkley, Clarkson Potter, Crown, DK, Doubleday, Dutton, Grosset \& Dunlap, Little Golden Books, Knopf, Modern Library, Pantheon, Penguin Books, Penguin Press, Penguin Random House Audio, Penguin Young Readers, Portfolio, Puffin, Putnam, Random House, Random House Children's Books, Riverhead, Ten Speed Press, Viking, and Vintage, among others. More information can be found at http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/.
  

  

Penguin Random House values the array of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are a fast growing women's fashion company and are hiring a Graphic Designer to execute creative assets across our DTC channels.

This is a production\-focused role. You’ll receive clear briefs, priorities, and feedback from the Head of Digital Commerce and be responsible for delivering fast, high\-quality assets that support conversion and performance.

We expect this person to be comfortable using and adapting AI tools to work faster, iterate more, and scale creative output.

**The Job**

* Design Email campaigns \& templates
* Design Homepage, PDPs, and collection pages
* Paid ad creative (static \+ light motion)
* Promotional and seasonal assets
* Execute within established brand guidelines
* Use AI tools where helpful (e.g. image generation, background extensions, resizing, variant creation) to improve speed and efficiency
* Turn feedback quickly and iterate based on performance insights
* Manage multiple requests across two brands with clear prioritization
* Prep and organize files for web, email, and paid media use
* Collaborate closely with eCommerce, paid media, and lifecycle partners as needed

**Skills**

* Figma, Adobe Creative Suite
* AI\-assisted creative tools (e.g. generative image tools, background removal/extension, resizing, variation generation)
* Slack \& Monday
* Shopify familiarity a plus
* Strong understanding of art direction, branding strategies, color management, typography, layout design, and typesetting.

**Who You Are**

* 3–7\+ years of graphic design experience
* Strong DTC / eCommerce portfolio (email, PDPs, ads)
* Comfortable working from clear briefs and deadlines
* Fast \& detail\-oriented
* Experience designing for conversion, not just aesthetics
* Comfortable learning and adopting AI tools as part of your workflow
* Strong organization and file management habits

Pay: $25\.00 \- $35\.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40\.0 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Application Question(s):

* Describe how you’ve used AI tools in your design workflow to increase speed or output. What tools did you use, and for what types of tasks?

Work Location: Remote

title: Marketing Designer
description:
Oshi Health is revolutionizing GI care with a digital clinic model that provides easy, convenient access to an integrated and multidisciplinary care team that takes a holistic approach to diagnosing, managing and treating digestive health conditions. Oshi Health has been recognized by Modern Healthcare and Builtin as the recipient of Best Place to Work awards. This recognition highlights our dedication to creating a workplace environment that prioritizes our team, fosters inclusivity, and is committed to our mission.



We take time to get to know each patient, develop a personalized, whole\-person care plan that includes identification of symptom triggers and prescription of evidence\-based interventions, including medications, dietary changes, and mental health support. Our care is delivered virtually through our app, via secure messaging and telehealth visits. When in\-person diagnostics or procedures are needed, we take a concierge approach and coordinate access, care and follow up with local providers. For more information, visit us at: www.oshihealth.com

  


**Oshi Health will never contact job candidates via text message or any other messaging platform including WhatsApp, Signal, and Telegram. All official correspondence will occur through email. We will never ask you to share bank account information, cash a check from us, or purchase software or equipment as part of your interview or hiring process. If you have concerns, please reach out to** **careers@oshihealth.com****, and we'll confirm whether** **you're engaging with one of our Oshi teammates!**

**Marketing Designer**


*Do you have strong visual design skills and love turning ideas into compelling creative that brings a brand to life across channels?*


*Are you excited by the opportunity to have a high\-visibility, high\-impact role at a fast\-moving startup where your work directly shapes how the world sees us?*


*Are you passionate about healthcare and eager to help reimagine digestive care through thoughtful, human\-centered design and a radically better patient experience?*


*If so, you could be a great fit for our team of like\-minded professionals who share a common mission, a deep care for patients, and a desire to build something truly meaningful together.*


**About the Role**



Oshi Health is looking for a Marketing Designer to join our Patient Marketing team and support the creation of on\-brand, high\-quality marketing assets across multiple channels. While you'll primarily design digital and print assets to drive patient acquisition, engagement, and retention, you'll also have an opportunity to flex your design skills to support occasional assets for commercial buyers.



The Marketing Designer reports to Oshi's Senior Designer and collaborates closely with content writers, product designers, commercial leads, and other cross\-functional partners to execute production design work that supports growth initiatives.



This is a full\-time role ideal for someone looking to apply their design skills within a digital health organization, thrive in a fast\-paced remote environment, and bring a collaborative, marketing\-minded approach to their work.


**Our Design Tools \& Process**



Design work is supported by established systems and clear workflows designed for speed and consistency.


* Figma is the primary design tool for all production work, templates, and reviews
* Work is managed through ClickUp with intake, prioritization, and feedback workflows
* Designers have access to Getty stock image and video libraries to support efficient asset creation
* Design systems, components, and shared libraries are actively maintained to support consistency and scalability


**What You'll Do:**


**Production Design \& Ownership**


* You'll own day\-to\-day production design work across patient marketing channels, managing requests from intake through final delivery.
* Own assigned production design tasks submitted through ClickUp, including:
* + Partner marketing assets
	+ Blog article visuals
	+ Layout updates and QA reviews
* Manage requests end\-to\-end, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and on\-brand execution
* Support project\-based deliverables such as:
* + Digital PDFs and gated content formatting
	+ Asset adaptations across channels
	+ Supporting creative assets for social and brand
* Adapt and resize existing designs to meet channel\-specific requirements while maintaining brand integrity
* Consistently apply established brand guidelines and ensure compliance with partner guidelines when applicable


**Social and Evolving Channels**



Marketing channels and formats continue to evolve, and this role should be comfortable adapting work accordingly to support channels like Meta, TikTok, YouTube and other new brand channels under the guidance of the Senior Designer


* The role is focused on production design and there are opportunities to support motion graphics or video adaptations for social posts and patient education, including creating motion graphics from vector artwork and selecting footage for social media edits
* Interest in motion graphics and video editing is a strong plus.


**Cross\-Functional Collaboration**



You'll collaborate closely with cross\-functional partners to support efficient, high\-quality execution.


* Work closely with content, partner, growth, and commercial teams to execute design needs consistently and on time
* Apply brand guidelines, templates, and systems with a focus on clarity, accessibility, and patient experience
* Execute work under the guidance of a Senior Designer, incorporating art direction, feedback, and prioritization support
* Proactively flag missing inputs, inconsistencies, or risks to quality or timelines
* Support cross\-functional teams, including the commercial team, with assets such as case studies, LinkedIn content, and patient education materials


**Process \& Team Contribution**



This role is deeply embedded in production workflows and contributes to continuous process improvement.


* Maintain strong task hygiene in ClickUp, including clear status updates and delivery notes
* Contribute to improving templates, shared libraries, and repeatable workflows over time
* Build independence and confidence in execution while developing toward mid\-level responsibilities, supported by established systems and senior guidance


**Who you are:**


* 2–6 years of professional design experience (freelance experience welcome)
* Strong foundational design skills, including layout, typography, hierarchy, and spacing
* Proficiency in Figma, including working with components and shared libraries
* Ability to execute landing page updates in a CMS such as WordPress, working within existing templates and layouts
* Familiarity with email and web design best practices
* Working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, After Effects)
* Basic understanding of accessibility principles (contrast, readability, hierarchy)
* Ability to work efficiently within established brand systems and templates
* Excellent attention to detail and strong file organization habits
* Comfort managing multiple production tasks simultaneously


**Nice to Have**


* Experience designing in healthcare, wellness, or other regulated industries
* Strong skills in motion graphics or video editing


**Why You'll Love Working at Oshi Health****:**


**A Mission That Matters**


* Join a mission\-driven organization improving access to innovative, equitable digestive care for millions of patients.
* Work alongside a diverse, values\-driven team that lives our core values: *Own the Outcome, Do the Right Thing, Be Direct and Open, Learn and Improve, Team, Thrive on Diversity.*
* Engage in ongoing D\&I conversations and initiatives that shape how we work and grow together.


**We Invest in Our People**


* Competitive compensation, including bonus and meaningful equity opportunities.
* Comprehensive benefits: employer\-sponsored medical, dental, and vision insurance, plus a 401K.
* Access to a "Life Concierge" through Overalls—because life doesn't stop when work gets busy.
* Tailored professional development opportunities to support learning, growth, and career progression.


**Flexibility That Supports Real Life**


* Remote\-first, virtual culture—work from anywhere in the U.S. with flexibility to support your lifestyle.
* Flexible time off—take the time you need, when you need it.
* 11 paid company holidays to fully unplug and recharge.


**Connection \& Recognition**


* Regular team events, including virtual experiences and connection\-focused activities.
* Recognition of both professional achievements and personal milestones.


*Oshi Health is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*


*At Oshi, we determine salary ranges using market benchmarking and a geo\-neutral compensation philosophy—your pay is based on the role and level, not your location.We believe in offering competitive compensation that reflects your unique skills, experience, and qualifications. While the salary range provided outlines the potential earning scope for this role, final offers are tailored to each candidate's expertise, contributions, and alignment with internal equity among peers in similar roles. Oshi utilizes the entire compensation range, and we expect candidates offered positions with our company to fall widely throughout the range.The candidate we hire may have more experience (or less) than what is outlined in this job description. If that's the case, an updated level and salary range will be shared during the hiring process.*

  


Note: This job description serves as a general overview and may be subject to change based on organizational needs and requirements.



Oshi Health is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to creating a diverse work environment. To do that, we champion a workplace where each and every person is treated with dignity and respect and is valued for their unique perspective and contributions.  

  

Oshi Health's policy is to maintain a working environment that encourages mutual respect, promotes harmonious and congenial relationships between employees, and is free from all forms of discrimination and harassment of any employee (or applicant for employment or service provider) by anyone, including supervisors, co\-workers, vendors, or clients. Harassment and discrimination in any manner or form is expressly prohibited. There is no tolerance for discrimination or unequal treatment of any kind on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual and reproductive health decisions, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status or civil partnership/union status, familial status, military or veteran status, predisposition or carrier status, domestic violence victim status, alienage or citizenship status, unemployment status, sexual violence or stalking victim status, caregiver status, or any other characteristic protected by law.



This practice applies to all terms, conditions and privileges of employment including, but not limited to, recruitment, selection, promotion, demotion, transfer, layoff, rehire, termination of employment, development and training, compensation, benefits and retirement.

  

For more information, visit us at www.oshihealth.com

title: Graphic Designer
description:
CORE Foodservice is a national foodservice sales agency that blends engaged leadership with a deep network of market specialists across the U.S. With over 50 offices across the country, our goal is to hire the best people who want to move fast and make a large impact. Happy people do happy things; we allow our employees to focus on what they love to do.

 **Our Mission Statement: W.I.N.**

 **Willing \& Engaged \- Integrity \- Never Give Up**

 **All Together. Different.**

 *CORE Foodservice has a* *Marketing Specialist* *opportunity on the****Marketing Team****!*

  

The Marketing Team is responsible for supporting the organization and sales team. This includes creating, editing, and managing assets and content for internal use as well as with clients, distributor, and operator partners.

  


**This is a remote position.** **Candidates must** **reside within the continental United States** **and be permanent citizens.**

  

**Responsibilities/Duties/Functions/Tasks**


* Create marketing pieces as requested by the sales and support teams including but not limited to sell sheets, brochures, promotions, advertisements, menus, product tags and cross merchandising materials combining CORE’s client’s products
* Adhere to CORE Foodservice and our client’s brand guidelines and gain approval as needed
* Gather insights via Tastewise and Mintel to support marketing materials or sales team
* Flexible and responsive to sales team’s priorities
* Social media content creation for @corefoodservice corporate LinkedIn, Facebook, and Instagram.
* Report and record marketing activities
* Other duties as assigned

  


**Qualifications**

  


To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


* Understanding of the foodservice sales industry
* Ability to translate sales execution into assets
* Professional, positive and persuasive demeanor
* Excellent written and interpersonal communication skills
* Proficient in Microsoft Office 365 (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, SharePoint) and Adobe Creative Suite (Specifically Acrobat, Illustrator, InDesign Photoshop, and Premier Pro)
* Ability to work in a fast\-paced environment and handle multiple priorities
* Ability to meet deadlines
* Extremely Self Motivated
* Punctual, meticulous, and reliable

  


**Special Position Requirements**


* 3\+ years marketing experience
* Leadership skills
* Ability to work independently
* Time management
* Experience planning and executing organization of large assets and information architecture
* Possess a strong desire to WIN
* Excellent verbal, written and communication skills

  


**Preferences**

  

* Marketing or Graphic Design degrees preferred

  


**What can WE offer YOU?**

  


CORE Foodservice offers a competitive benefits package including:


* Annual Salary
* Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits
* 401K \+Match Eligibility
* Paid Time\-Off Programs
* Tuition Reimbursement Opportunity

title: Creative Designer
description:
**Company**


Securitas Technology, part of Securitas, is a world\-leading provider of integrated security solutions that protect, connect and optimize businesses of all types and sizes. More than 13,000 colleagues in 40 countries are focused daily on our purpose to help make your world a safer place and our commitment to deliver an unparalleled client experience. With clients at the heart of all we do, our people, knowledge and technology power our connected ecosystem of health, safety and security solutions and services.

**Overview**


The Creative Designer works on a diverse range of creative projects, collaborating with a global internal and external stakeholders. It is a job that require a “can do” attitude and a willingness to go beyond. The ideal candidate has a thorough understanding of branding and marketing, with a discerning eye and mind for identifying the right style and layout for every project. The Creative Designer interprets the requests of internal and external clients and turns them into design solutions with high visual impact. The role will require working in a variety of creative disciplines, supporting needs such as social media, trade show design, magazines ads, videos, brand identity and many other visual mediums in order to communicate the brand messages and ideas that inspire, inform, or captivate internal and external audiences.

**Responsibilities:**

* Graphic Design, Photo Editing, Video Editing ·
* Determine the best design to translate the message, promoting the brand standards.
* Produce content for global brand campaigns, internal presentations, and other external material such as print ads, digital banners, social media, short videos, and more. ·
* Strong customer service skills, recognizing the importance of supporting the needs of internal clients we work with, everyday ·
* Help define, plan and resource content design strategy, based on best practices, user research and online/offline content design trends and content consumption.
* Conceptualize, design and execute original material in print and/or digital, video, online, digital, interactive and experiential mediums.
* Use data and content engagement metrics to continuously optimize design approach, strategy, and production.
* Help oversee day\-to\-day production of multimedia projects and program activities, ensuring content design, visual storytelling and brand best practices are upheld through all touchpoints.
* Help support/lead projects with external partners
* Provide guidance and consulting to country marketing teams on content design and optimization opportunities along with Global Creative Director ·
* Define, develop and maintain the branding guidelines whilst ensuring they resonate with the overall strategy and positioning of the business

**Qualifications:**

* A Bachelor’s degree in graphic design or a related field, and a full understanding of the creative process and how to apply that in a fast\-paced, demanding business environment ·
* Corporate business environment experience a must ·
* Minimum 5\+ years of Graphic designer experience, developing and designing brand initiatives
* Knowledge of and Expertise In the Adobe Creative Suite: Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere, After Effects Preferred:
* Video production experience (production and post\-production) is a major plus
* Self\-motivated and highly organized
* Process and detail\-oriented
* Humble approach to design, recognizing the importance of serving key internal stakeholders
* Excellent \& adaptable communication skills: need to proactively communicate at all levels internally and externally.
* Able to multitask and manage multiple projects at a time while adhering to deadlines ·
* Prioritize quality over quantity at all times
* Committed \& “can\-do” attitude
* Drive, energy, enthusiasm \& determination to succeed ·

title: Instructional Design Manager
description:
Job Summary: The Instructional Design Manager will oversee end\-to\-end design of K\-12 instructional materials for Braintree Educational Services. This individual will ensure that learning materials meet standards for quality, accessibility, and consistency across all grades in K\-12\. The Instructional Design Manager will facilitate vertical and horizontal consistency in design and collaboration between Subject Matter Experts, stakeholders, and graphic designers to create innovative learning experiences.  

Job Duties and Responsibilities:  

Project \& Strategic Oversight  

* Workflow Management: Maintain and monitor project lists and completion timelines to ensure on\-time delivery.
* Team Leadership: Supervise and mentor Graphic Designers and Team Members, fostering a high\-performance creative environment.


Quality Control \& Standards  

* Design Excellence: Direct quality control processes for instructional design, ensuring all content meets high standards for instructional design consistence and digital accessibility.
* Alignment \& Compliance: Ensure all course materials align with Braintree ID principles, as well as Quality Matters (QM) and NSQ standards.
* Continuity Management: Maintain horizontal and vertical continuity across the curriculum, ensuring a natural and consistent learning flow from K through 12\.


Learning Architecture \& Innovation  

* Model Integration: Balance and implement diverse ID models within the Braintree ecosystem, specifically First Principles of Instruction and Braintree Instructional Principles
* Template Development: Create and maintain standardized templates to ensure horizontal and vertical consistency across Braintree.
* SME Collaboration: Facilitate a collaborative environment that allows for SME innovation while maintaining necessary structural continuity.

  

Core Competencies  

* Hands\-on Development: Lead by example by engaging in the hands\-on design of various courses each semester.
* Proficiency in managing cross\-functional teams (Designers, team members, and Stakeholders).
* Deep understanding of Instructional Design models and accessibility standards.
* Strong project management skills with a focus on detail and deadlines.


This position exercises discretion and independent judgment with respect to matters of significance.  

Experience and Qualifications:* Master’s Degree highly preferred in Instructional Design, Educational Technology, Curriculum and Instruction, or a closely related field.
* Expertise in Quality Matters (QM) and NSQ standards and their application in digital learning environments.
* Knowledge of accessibility standards (WCAG 2\.1/2\.2\) and UDL (Universal Design for Learning) principles
* Experience in building or adapting content for an LMS
* Collaboration and project management experience

title: Freelance Graphic Designer
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a talented and motivated Freelance Graphic Designer to collaborate on a variety of on\-call creative projects. This role offers flexibility and the opportunity to work remotely, contributing to branding, digital art, and visual design initiatives. The ideal candidate will possess a strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in visual communication, information graphics, and print design. As a freelance professional, you will bring innovative ideas and technical skills to produce compelling visuals that align with client objectives and brand identities.

**Duties**

* Develop and execute creative concepts for digital content.
* Design logos, illustrations, layouts, and visual assets using industry\-standard tools such as latest Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).
* Collaborate with clients to understand project requirements and deliver designs that meet their vision.
* Manage digital design projects from concept through completion, ensuring consistency in style, color management, typography, and overall aesthetic.
* Produce print advertising materials and signage for promotional purposes.
* Maintain current knowledge of industry trends in digital art and visual design.

**Requirements**

* Proven experience in graphic design with a strong portfolio showcasing branding, logo design, and print advertising.
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).
* Skills in digital art creation including photo manipulation, photo editing, and digital illustration.
* Understanding of color theory, typography, layout design, typesetting, color management for print and digital media.
* Ability to work independently with excellent time management skills to meet project deadlines.
* Strong communication skills for presenting ideas and collaborating with clients remotely.
* This position will be entirely on\-call (or as needed) and offers the flexibility to work from anywhere and challenge your artistic talents and technical expertise in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign and potentially more.
* Personal work station with Macintosh platform and utilize latest version of Adobe Creative Cloud/Adobe Creative Suite

Pay: $25\.00 \- $30\.00 per hour

Expected hours: 4\.0 – 20\.0 per week

Education:

* Associate (Preferred)

Experience:

* Graphic design: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: GRAPHIC DESIGNER - ADVERTISING
description:
### **WHY YOU SHOULD APPLY**



Coalition Technologies is devoted to delivering clients the highest quality work while providing our team a fun, thriving, and innovative environment. Along with the opportunity for tremendous career growth and rapid advancement, CT offers:


* The most competitive profit\-sharing bonus plan in the industry, paying up to 50% of company profits to full\-time employees each month!
* A highly competitive Paid Time Off plan, promoting quality work\-life balance.
* Subsidized gym memberships to help team members feel their best.
* Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance packages for all US\-based team members.
* International Health Insurance Reimbursement Program for all international team members, a benefit unique to Coalition.
* Device upgrade and learning reimbursement programs.
* Motivating career development plans with clearly defined goals and rewards.
* Additional job\-specific incentives and bonuses.
* Plus, 100% of our team works remotely with the support of time tracking software. Our company culture specializes in supporting remote team members, and we’ve been doing so for more than a decade. CT welcomes your application, wherever in the world it's coming from!

### **YOU SHOULD HAVE**


* Total mastery of photo and editing software.
* A passion for design, branding, marketing, advertising, and online content creation.
* A general understanding of social media platforms such as Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Tik Tok, Pinterest, Tumblr, and LinkedIn.
* A desire to continue learning and to keep up with the design industry.
* An awesome portfolio showcasing experience in designing ad banners, marketing emails, social media posts, and logos (infographics, slide presentations, and print designs are also welcome).
* Knowledge of the Google Ads and Facebook Ads platforms (highly preferred).
* Knowledge of Klaviyo and Mailchimp (preferred).
* Experience with project tools such as Basecamp, QuickBooks, and Google Docs (preferred).
* Bonus points for familiarity with video editing and motion graphics software such as Adobe Premiere and After Effects.
* Bonus points for illustration or traditional drawing skills.
* Excellent written and spoken English.
* Professional experience working with advertising agencies or in digital marketing (preferred).
* The ability to perform well under pressure and under short deadlines.
* Experience presenting materials to clients professionally.
* The availability to work 40 hours per week from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm Pacific Standard Time, Monday to Friday.
* A reliable workstation with a fast computer, microphone, and speakers, and reliable internet and power.

### **YOUR DUTIES AND TASKS**


* Designing both static and animated banners for ad campaigns.
* Designing emails for email marketing campaigns.
* Designing posts and other images for social media platforms such as Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.
* Designing unique logos and brand guides from scratch.
* Drawing vector icons and illustrations.
* Designing print material such as brochures, letterheads, and business cards.
* Designing website mockups and related graphics for both desktop and mobile to support the web design team when needed.
* Participating in client meetings and working with our Digital Producers to strategize achievement of client goals through creative but clear and effective design.
* Collaborating with our copywriters, PPC team, and other teams to establish the vision of the project, come up with creative concepts, and analyze tradeoffs between visual appeal and performance needs.
* Preparing well\-organized design files.
* Ensuring that projects are completed on schedule while effectively applying our methodology and following quality standards.


We are looking for talented and diligent candidates who excel in our skills tests, and will consider these candidates even if past experience or educational background criteria aren't met.


*California, New York, Washington, and Colorado: starting base pay for this position ranges between $17 \- $35 per hour. Compensation may vary based on factors such as experience, qualifications, skills test performance, geographic location, and seniority of the position offered. Outside of California, New York, Washington, and Colorado compensation may fall outside the above ranges.*

title: Contract Graphic Designer
description:
