Coalition Technologies is devoted to delivering the highest quality work for clients while providing our team a fun, thriving, and innovative environment. Along with the opportunity for tremendous career growth and rapid advancement, CT offers:


* The most competitive profit\-sharing bonus plan in the industry, paying up to 50% of company profits to full\-time employees each month!
* A highly competitive Paid Time Off plan, promoting quality work\-life balance.
* Subsidized gym memberships to help team members feel their best.
* Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance packages for all US\-based team members.
* International Health Insurance Reimbursement Program for all international team members, a benefit unique to Coalition.
* Device upgrade and learning reimbursement programs.
* Motivating career development plans with clearly defined goals and rewards.
* Additional job\-specific incentives and bonuses.
* Plus, 100% of our team works remotely with the support of time tracking software. Our company culture specializes in supporting remote team members, and we've been doing so for more than a decade. CT welcomes your application, wherever in the world it's coming from!

### **YOU SHOULD HAVE:**


* Proven motion graphics and video editing experience.
* Proficiency with video editing software.
* The ability to write and produce short\-form promotional videos from start to finish.
* Familiarity with social media platforms such as Instagram, Facebook, and TikTok.
* Experience producing videos and animation for social media and YouTube (preferred).
* Experience with online advertising is a plus.
* Graphic design, 3D modeling, and/or illustration skills are a plus.
* Your own camera, lighting, and space for shooting videos by yourself.
* The ability to record narrations.
* Good written and spoken English skills.
* The ability to perform well under pressure and under short deadlines.
* Experience presenting materials to clients professionally.
* The availability to work 40 hours per week from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm PST.
* A reliable workstation with a fast computer for video editing.
* Microphone and speakers, reliable internet and power.

### **YOUR DUTIES AND TASKS:**


* Creating promotional videos for Coalition Technologies and our clients.
* Creating videos and animated banners to be used for ad campaigns.
* Creating short\-format videos for Instagram Stories, Reels, YouTube Shorts, TikTok, etc.
* Creating text, logo, character, or other kinds of animations to be used in videos, websites, emails, and other media.
* Properly following briefs and being able to work with scripts, design assets, and footage provided by clients and other team members.
* Coming up with ideas (writing scripts and/or creating storyboards).
* Attending and/or participating in client meetings and working with our Digital Producers to plan how to achieve the client goals through video and animation.
* Collaborating with the graphic designers, copywriters, PPC team, and other teams to establish the vision of the project, come up with creative concepts, and analyze tradeoffs between visual appeal and performance needs.
* Encoding videos for any required format and uploading to media sources.
* Keeping up with the latest trends in storytelling, video production, and social media.
* Ensuring that projects are completed according to schedule while effectively applying our methodology and following quality standards.


We are looking for talented and diligent candidates who excel in our skills tests, and will consider these candidates even if past experience or educational background criteria aren't met.


*California, New York, Washington, and Colorado: starting base pay for this position ranges between $17 \- $35 per hour. Compensation may vary based on factors such as experience, qualifications, skills test performance, geographic location, and seniority of the position offered. Outside of California, New York, Washington, and Colorado compensation may fall outside the above ranges.*

title: Senior Apparel Graphic Designer – Men’s Streetwear
description:
**Senior Apparel Graphic Designer (Men’s Streetwear)**

**This is not a Canva job.** If your idea of design is copy\-pasting vintage art, slapping type on a tee, and calling it a day — this is not for you.

**The Mission**

Jordan Craig and See You in Paradise have been building strong men’s silhouettes for nearly three decades. Now we’re expanding the line with **graphics that hit just as hard as the garments themselves**.

We already have many talented apparel designers who can design beautiful jean washes and killer jackets, but we are looking to add more **top\-tier graphic designers** who can elevate tees, fleece, outerwear, and full collections with cohesive, intentional graphics.

That’s the gap. That’s the role.

We’re looking for a **real apparel graphic designer** — someone who understands how **image, type, fabric, ink, and culture** come together to make a piece hit *hard*. Someone who can build cohesive graphics from scratch, not Frankenstein layouts from Pinterest.

**What You’ll Actually Be Doing**

* Designing **original graphics and typography** for: T\-shirts, hoodies, jackets, denim, fleece, outerwear
* Creating **cohesive graphic systems**, not one\-off random hits
* Designing with **print reality in mind**:
* Understanding how **ink interacts with fabric**:
* Prepping **print\-ready files** factories and printers can actually use
* Contributing to **brand identity**, not just seasonal graphics

**What We’re Looking For**

* You **design from concept**, not from Google Images
* You understand **streetwear, men’s fashion, and culture**
* You’ve worked in **apparel**, not just digital or branding
* Expert in the printing process \- the print shop makes perfect samples with our files in one shot
* Ability to build **full graphic stories**, not isolated designs

**The Vibe**

We’re building real product, not watered\-down, suburban, safe graphics.

This is for designers who care about **taste, execution, and authenticity**.

**If you do not give a link to your portfolio you will not be considered.** 

Links to our brands:

https://jordancraig.com/

https://seeyouinparadise.com/

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: From $100,000\.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Application Question(s):

* Please link your portfolio here. Only applicants with portfolios will be considered. Thank you.

Work Location: Remote

title: Revenue Operations Analyst
description:
At Aquacycl, we are redefining the water treatment industry with innovative solutions that prioritize efficiency, cost\-savings and sustainability. As a dynamic start\-up, we offer a fast\-paced, mission\-driven organization that values curiosity, resilience, and a passion for making a positive impact on the world.

**Who thrives at Aquacycl?** 

* **Innovative Problem Solvers:** You are constantly curious, taking initiative to ask questions and do research to tackle challenges without a guidebook and finding creative solutions even when the path forward is unclear.
* **Passionate and Driven:** You are deeply committed to making a positive impact, motivated by the opportunity to contribute to meaningful change, and share our mission of access and sustainability in the water treatment sector.
* **Collaborative Team Players:** You work well in a team, valuing diverse perspectives, sharing knowledge, can share and receive constructive criticism, and contribute to a supportive, dynamic work environment.
* **Adaptable and Flexible:** You consistently step outside your comfort zone, embracing new challenges and roles in our ever\-evolving start\-up environment with a proactive approach to addressing issues.
* **Self\-Starters:** You are driven to achieve results and eager to bring fresh, creative ideas, and challenge the status quo.

We're a great fit for you if you find yourself saying, 'That's me!'

**The Task at Hand:**

As a Graphic Designer, you will play a crucial role in shaping and maintaining Aquacycl’s visual identity. Your primary focus will be to create and manage branded content across various platforms, including marketing collateral, social media, tradeshows, and videos. You will work closely with cross\-functional teams to ensure a cohesive and compelling brand presence that resonates with our customers.

**In This Role, You Will:**

The Revenue Operations Analyst will play a central role in building and optimizing Aquacycl’s revenue engine. This role is responsible for the systems, data infrastructure, and workflows that power the full revenue lifecycle, from first touch through closed\-won and long\-term customer value.

You will help align marketing and sales around shared revenue goals, standardized definitions, and trusted performance metrics.

This role blends systems thinking, analytics, and operational execution to create clarity, efficiency, and scalability across the funnel. The RevOps Analyst will report to the Sr. Director of Marketing.

**In This Role, You Will:** 

Serve as a core operator of Aquacycl’s revenue system, owning the infrastructure that drives lead flow, pipeline health, and revenue visibility. You will design scalable CRM architecture, automation, and reporting systems that enable performance rather than friction.

You will translate data into actionable insight, identify risks and opportunities across the funnel, optimize conversion and velocity, and continuously improve how prospects move through the revenue lifecycle.

**Revenue Systems (HubSpot) \& Lifecyle Optimization** 

* Own CRM architecture, workflows, automation, and lifecycle definitions
* Maintain data integrity through audits, cleansing, and enrichment
* Support forecasting accuracy and pipeline visibility for leadership
* Build scalable and repeatable infrastructure for growth

**Lead Generation \& Campaign Performance** 

* Use insights to improve sales and marketing engagement and conversion metrics
* Build lists, segment contacts, and manage outbound sales sequences
* Monitor and improve campaign quality, cadence, and targeting

**Reporting \& Analytics** 

* Build and manage dashboards, KPIs, and ROI tracking in HubSpot
* Create reports to measure spending, engagement, and conversion
* Translate performance data into strategic recommendations
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**In This Role, You’ll Bring With You:**

* Minimum: Bachelor’s degree
* 3\+ years HubSpot CRM and automation experience
* 3\+ years of data management and workflow implementation
* 5\+ years Microsoft Office (Excel \& PowerPoint proficiency)
* 3\+ years B2B experience, preferably in a tech or manufacturing environment
* Strong organizational, analytical, and project management skills
* Excellent communication skills, self\-motivation, outstanding organizational and time management skills, a high\-level of initiative, flexibility to handle a variety of tasks and be able to shift priorities quickly.

**Location:** 

* This position can be remote or hybrid with occasional in\-office work at the Escondido, CA location. The employee must be comfortable working independently and collaborating virtually with teams across time zones

**Compensation:** 

* $80\-85k annually

**Benefits**:

* Employee Equity
* 15 Company Holidays \+ 15 Accrued Vacation days
* We contribute to a variety of Aetna and Kaiser healthcare plans, offering employees multiple options at a reduced cost.
* Flexible spending account (Medical \& Dependent Care) and Health savings accounts for applicable plans
* Employee assistance program (EAP)
* Dog Friendly Office

**About Aquacycl** 

Aquacycl is an Escondido\-based early\-stage company working to transform how wastewater treatment is done by providing cost\-effective and reliable technologies combined with outstanding customer service (www.aquacycl.com).

Aquacycl has developed patented technology that is the only market solution for direct treatment of some of the most challenging industrial wastewaters. However, industrial applications are just the beginning. Aquacycl’s team is committed to making a better/cleaner environment with the mission of providing “Sanitation and water for all”.

Aquacycl provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: $80,000\.00 \- $85,000\.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Experience:

* Microsoft Excel: 5 years (Preferred)
* B2B sales: 3 years (Preferred)
* CRM software: 3 years (Required)
* Data Management : 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Graphic Design Intern for Content Creation
description:
**Job Summary**  
I are seeking a creative and motivated Graphic Design Intern for Content Creation to join my dynamic team. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to develop your skills in visual design, digital art, and content production while working on real\-world projects. The ideal candidate will have a passion for branding, and innovative design techniques, with a keen eye for detail and a strong desire to learn.

**Duties**

* Assist in creating compelling visual content across various platforms, including social media, websites, and print materials.
* Support the development of branding assets such as logos, icons, and visual themes.
* Manage and update content within WordPress and other content management systems.

**Requirements**

* Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and familiarity with Figma, Sketch, CorelDRAW.
* Experience with motion graphics software such as Adobe After Effects; basic video editing skills are a plus.
* Knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript is desirable for web design projects.
* Strong understanding of color theory, typography, layout design, and visual storytelling principles.
* Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment.
* Familiarity with content management systems like WordPress; experience with web design is advantageous.
* Passion for digital art, graphic design, UI/UX principles, and innovative content creation techniques. This internship provides hands\-on experience in a fast\-paced creative environment where you can refine your skills across multiple disciplines within graphic design and digital media production.

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

title: Graphic Designer
description:
**Overview**  
We are seeking a talented and creative Graphic Designer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong artistic vision and the ability to translate ideas into visually compelling designs. As a Graphic Designer, you will work on a variety of projects, from digital art and motion graphics to typography and photo manipulation, contributing to our brand's identity and marketing efforts.

**Responsibilities**

* Collaborate with clients and team members to understand design requirements and project objectives.
* Create visually engaging graphics for digital platforms, including websites, social media, and marketing materials.

* A solid portfolio showcasing previous design work that demonstrates creativity and technical skills.

* Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and clients.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines.

Join us in shaping visual narratives that resonate with audiences! We look forward to seeing your creativity come to life through your designs.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are a fast growing women's fashion company and are hiring a Graphic Designer to execute creative assets across our DTC channels.

This is a production\-focused role. You’ll receive clear briefs, priorities, and feedback from the Head of Digital Commerce and be responsible for delivering fast, high\-quality assets that support conversion and performance.

We expect this person to be comfortable using and adapting AI tools to work faster, iterate more, and scale creative output.

**The Job**

* Design Email campaigns \& templates
* Design Homepage, PDPs, and collection pages
* Paid ad creative (static \+ light motion)
* Promotional and seasonal assets
* Execute within established brand guidelines
* Use AI tools where helpful (e.g. image generation, background extensions, resizing, variant creation) to improve speed and efficiency
* Turn feedback quickly and iterate based on performance insights
* Manage multiple requests across two brands with clear prioritization
* Prep and organize files for web, email, and paid media use
* Collaborate closely with eCommerce, paid media, and lifecycle partners as needed

**Skills**

* Figma, Adobe Creative Suite
* AI\-assisted creative tools (e.g. generative image tools, background removal/extension, resizing, variation generation)
* Slack \& Monday
* Shopify familiarity a plus
* Strong understanding of art direction, branding strategies, color management, typography, layout design, and typesetting.

**Who You Are**

* 3–7\+ years of graphic design experience
* Strong DTC / eCommerce portfolio (email, PDPs, ads)
* Comfortable working from clear briefs and deadlines
* Fast \& detail\-oriented
* Experience designing for conversion, not just aesthetics
* Comfortable learning and adopting AI tools as part of your workflow
* Strong organization and file management habits

Pay: $25\.00 \- $35\.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40\.0 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Application Question(s):

* Describe how you’ve used AI tools in your design workflow to increase speed or output. What tools did you use, and for what types of tasks?

Work Location: Remote

title: Graphic Designer
description:
**About XWP**


XWP has collaborated on some of the most ambitious and successful WordPress projects and partnered with the likes of Google, Forbes, News Corp, and Penske Media Corporation (PMC) to bring richer technologies and delightful user experiences to the open web.


You’ll be joining a team of 55\+ experts (from 25\+ countries and 6 continents) who enjoy challenging work, service\-focused and collaborative teammates, and opportunities to grow and learn. We have a passion and enthusiasm for our craft and a sincere care for each other and the clients we serve.

 **About The Role**


This role supports our Sales and Marketing momentum during a transitional period. It’s not a full\-time position, but the work is meaningful, visible, and collaborative.


If you enjoy contributing excellent design work without the overhead of long\-term role commitments, this may be a great fit.

 **Who You Are**


You’re someone who:

* Brings 3\+ years of professional experience in a graphic or digital design role, ideally with a marketing or agency environment
* Has a portfolio demonstrating consistent application of established brand guidelines
* Works efficiently with feedback and quick iteration cycles
* Communicates clearly in a remote, async environment
* Is reliable for short\-term, deadline\-driven requests

**What You'll Do at XWP**

* Social media graphics and campaign assets
* Polishing and enhancing sales decks and presentations
* Light brand adaptation and layout work
* Occasional short\-form video editing (nice to have, not required)

**Tools \& Skills**

* Figma (required)
* Adobe Creative Suite or Canva
* Experience designing for social platforms and presentations
* Basic video editing skills (bonus)
* Understanding of visual hierarchy, typography, and accessibility best practices

**Experience that helps**

* Marketing or sales\-enablement design experience
* B2B, SaaS, or agency background
* Remote freelance collaboration with globally distributed teams

**Payscale \& Benefits**

* Trust and support from your colleagues (we look out for each other and work together towards our shared goals and vision)
* The rewards of a highly collaborative culture (we’re a team, not a working group)
* The joys of remote work done right (schedule flexibility, skip the commute, more time for family and interests outside of work)
* The chance to play an important part in helping XWP achieve its full potential and make a meaningful difference for our clients, team members and the open web.
* An expected contractor rate of USD $20\-30 per hour.

 **XWP is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all team members. We’re proud of the high levels of inclusion that our distributed team reports and we work hard to support each individual doing their best work together at XWP.**

 **The pay range for this role is:**  

20 \- 30 USD per hour(Remote)

title: Graphic Designer - Hunting & Fishing Industry Experience Required
description:
Oxbow USA is a specialized marketing agency focused exclusively on helping hunting, fishing, and outdoor lifestyle brands dominate online through gritty, results\-driven strategies. We work with gear makers, outfitters, knife brands, bait companies, and more—no fluff, just real growth in the outdoors space.

**The Role**

We're seeking a talented Graphic Designer who has **specific, proven experience working in the hunting and fishing industry** (or closely related outdoor/tactical sectors). This is a hard requirement—we are not considering candidates without this niche background. You'll create high\-impact visuals that resonate with serious hunters, anglers, and outdoor enthusiasts: social media ads/graphics, branding assets, website elements, email campaigns, video thumbnails/edits, product mockups, and more.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Design eye\-catching graphics and layouts tailored to hunting/fishing audiences (e.g., Meta/Instagram ads, promotional banners, product visuals).
* Collaborate on full\-funnel creative: awareness content to conversion\-focused offers.
* Maintain brand authenticity and "no\-BS" style for our outdoor clients.
* Edit photos/videos as needed for outdoors\-themed campaigns.

**Must\-Have Qualifications**

* Demonstrated graphic design experience **exclusively or primarily in hunting, fishing, outdoors, tactical, or related industries** (e.g., worked for gear brands, bait companies, outfitters, hunting media, etc.).
* Strong portfolio showcasing hunting/fishing\-specific work (links required in application).
* Proficiency in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign (and ideally After Effects/Premiere for motion).
* Understanding of outdoor audience preferences (grit, authenticity, lifestyle imagery).
* Ability to work independently in a fast\-paced agency environment.

Pay: $25\.00 \- $65\.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Work Location: Remote

title: Contract forms designer
description:
**Position Summary**

We are seeking a detail\-oriented Forms Designer to support the creation, maintenance, and ongoing updates of professional forms and publications. This role primarily works in **Adobe InDesign** and focuses on producing clean, accurate, and user\-friendly documents that meet branding, formatting, and compliance standards. The ideal candidate has a strong eye for layout, exceptional attention to detail, and experience managing complex, text\-heavy documents.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Design, format, and update a wide range of forms and documents using **Adobe InDesign**
* Apply and maintain paragraph, character, object styles, and master pages for consistency
* Prepare print\-ready and digital\-ready files (including interactive PDFs when needed)
* Incorporate edits, redlines, and revisions accurately and efficiently
* Collaborate with internal teams (legal, product, marketing, and operations) to implement content changes
* Ensure documents meet branding standards, accessibility best practices, and version control requirements
* Troubleshoot formatting issues and improve existing templates and workflows
* Organize and maintain design files and archives

**Required Qualifications**

* 2\+ years of professional experience using **Adobe InDesign**
* Strong understanding of typography, layout, and document structure
* Experience working with long\-form or forms\-based documents
* High level of accuracy and attention to detail
* Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines
* Proficiency with Adobe Acrobat and Microsoft Office

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Experience creating or maintaining legal, business, or technical forms
* Familiarity with accessibility standards (PDF accessibility a plus)
* Basic knowledge of Adobe Illustrator and/or Photoshop
* Experience maintaining document templates and style libraries

**Skills \& Attributes**

* Highly organized and process\-driven
* Strong written communication skills
* Comfortable working with feedback and frequent revisions
* Self\-motivated and collaborative

Pay: From $30\.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 5\.0 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Work Location: Remote

title: Visual Designer (Recreation)
description:
**Who we are**


DaySmart supercharges experienced\-based businesses with innovative, industry\-specific software services that power customer and revenue growth. With thousands of partners worldwide and dozens of industry awards, we provide best\-in\-class solutions to accelerate their business.


This role is part of DaySmart’s Recreation Business Unit, which is comprised of four DaySmart brands (Dash, Sawyer, TeamUp, and BoxMate) that deliver activity booking software for our customers: sports facilities, children’s education business, and group fitness gyms.


**About the Role**


This will be a remote, US based position working east coast hours alongside a remote team. We’re looking for a Visual Designer to help bring our multiple recreation brands to life and better connect with our customers. You’ll design across a breadth of channels (websites and landing pages, digital advertising, emails, and more). This role is best suited for a visual thinker, an appreciator of silly gifs, and an organized go\-getter who can quickly grasp core messages and bring them to life in creative ways. This role will report to the Director of Creative.


**Responsibilities**


* Bring DaySmart’s recreation brands to life: concept and design landing pages, marketing emails, digital ads, landing pages, blog visuals, and other digital marketing assets and collateral.
* Learn how our products uniquely address the needs of various audiences (businesses and their end\-customers across several industries) and leverage these insights in your work.
* Work closely with the Marketing team to implement each brand’s vision and style with clarity and consistency across all channels.
* Proactively and clearly communicate your ideas and design decisions to the team
* Effectively leverage our ESPs (Mailchimp, Pardot) to create email campaigns using best practices while maintaining a high quality of design.
* Source, edit, and optimize photography that fits within brand guidelines.
* Use and build brand and campaign templates for creative production across channels.
* Work with Product, Sales, and Customer Success teams on ongoing product education and feature launches.
* Work with the Marketing and Data teams to test, analyze, and optimize designs.
* Assist in building and designing pages in Figma and Webflow.
* Juggle several different projects with good intuition about when to create pixel\-perfect designs vs. taking a low\-lift approach.
* Follow and build upon brand guidelines, helping to create and organize the visual language of our brands and maintain our asset libraries in Figma.
* Incorporate and edit existing brand assets (illustrations, icons, etc) for use in designs.


**Requirements**


* You’re passionate and curious about creating quality, compelling, and unique design work, and are open to feedback to help make the things you create even better.
* You have a demonstrable understanding of design fundamentals with exceptional attention to detail in typography, color usage, composition, and layout.
* Expertise in using Figma as well as Illustrator and Photoshop
* You have experience designing responsive websites, preferably using Webflow
* You have experience designing digital ads across a variety of channels
* You have a portfolio demonstrating your conceptual design thinking and execution across various digital platforms and channels.
* Knowledge or willingness to learn design best practices for increased quality, accessibility, engagement, and conversion.
* You’re a collaborator, willing to share your process and work\-in\-progress with the team – and to accept feedback and incorporate insights into your designs.
* Be a good human. We are a thoughtful, honest, and kind team with a healthy sense of humor.


**A little more about you**


* 3\+ years of brand/visual design experience with a focus in digital marketing or advertising.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a design related discipline such as graphic design, visual communications, or interaction design.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment
* Highly organized; able to balance priorities and work efficiently with focus. We believe in getting work done without micromanaging anyone.
* You’re no stranger to a modern work environment and are comfortable with tools like Slack, Dropbox, Notion, and Microsoft 365 or Google Workplace
* You’re ready to step up when it comes to seeing through a project: from sharing your notes to following up on unanswered questions.
* You have high standards for your work and thrive on a team that shares ideas and continually seeks opportunities to raise the bar.


**Nice to have**


* Animation and/or Motion design skills
* Video editing experience
* Foundational understanding of how websites are built (HTML, CSS, and JavaScript)
* Ability to create illustrations in a brand illustration style
* Familiarity with After Effects, InDesign, Zeplin, Lightroom


**Please note: Applications without links to a portfolio will not be considered.**


**Salary**


The salary for this role is $75,000 \- $85,000 per year. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, internal equity, etc.


**What We Offer**


* Competitive salary and benefits including medical, dental, vision, HSA, FSA, and more!
* 401k plan with company match on your contributions.
* Open PTO and a generous paid holiday schedule.
* Supportive work environment with the flexibility to work where/how you want – in\-office, remote, or hybrid.
* Opportunities to ensure you are always learning and growing.


**How You Will Work**


This will be a US based position working east coast hours with a remote team. We offer flexible work arrangements including fully remote, in person or hybrid opportunities. For those looking to work in person, we have physical offices in the following cities:


Ann Arbor, MI  

Wayne, PA  

Austin, TX


Many DaySmart employees primarily work from home, and our teams are structured to operate efficiently in a distributed environment. While we don’t always share a physical office, we work together closely through remote collaboration practices.


We maintain a highly collaborative culture and expect all employees to actively participate in meetings, discussions, and team interactions. This includes joining scheduled video calls with cameras on, contributing to conversations, and being fully present.  

We believe that strong communication and visual connection are essential to maintaining alignment, accountability, and trust across our teams. At DaySmart, working remotely comes with the responsibility to show up, engage, and collaborate with intention.


**Your safety is important to us!**


We’ve recently identified an increase in fraudulent activity targeting individuals who have applied to positions at DaySmart. Please note that any legitimate communication regarding your application will come either from an official DaySmart email address (ending in @daysmart.com) or directly through our Applicant Tracking System.


Please refer to DaySmart Privacy Policy to learn more about how we are committed to respecting your privacy and the security of your personal information.


DaySmart is committed to creating a diverse employee environment and is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Presentation designer and Word Documentation Specialist
Manager, Creative Lead, Art Director
description:
**About the Team**
------------------



Superette is DoorDash's award\-winning in\-house creative studio. We create work that's sharp, memorable, and part of the conversation, blurring the lines between brand and culture, storytelling and utility, entertainment and effectiveness.



We exist to build a brand people actually care about. One that shows up meaningfully across every touchpoint and earns its place in culture through creativity that hits hard and sticks. Our studio is stacked with some of the best talent in the game, and our ambition is simple: raise the bar with every brief.



In 2024, we were named the \#2 in\-house studio by The One Show and The Drum. DoorDash landed on Fast Company's Brands That Matter list, US Weekly's Top 50 Hottest Brands, and was ranked one of the Top 10 Most Creative Brands in the World by Cannes Lions. And we're just getting started.


**About the Role**
------------------



We're looking for an ideas\-first Creative Lead, Art Director background. Someone who starts with a strong concept, not just aesthetics, and takes full ownership of the work from start to finish. This is a hands\-on senior creative role for someone who wants to be in the work, not managing from the sidelines. You'll be one of the senior creatives in the studio, shaping campaigns that move fast, stand out, and leave a mark on culture.



You have a sharp eye for visual storytelling and design. You know how to define the look and feel of a campaign in a way that's both bold and cohesive. You're just as comfortable working on large\-scale productions as you are creating something powerful on your own. Big budgets aren't a requirement for you to make something great; you're proactive, hands\-on, and always pushing the work forward. You don't wait for the perfect brief; you understand the brand, spot the opportunity, and come up with smart, creative solutions that move the needle.



You embrace AI as a creative tool that expands what's possible. You'll collaborate with writers, designers, producers, and teams across Brand and Social to craft work that drives real business results while pushing creative standards forward. If you bring fresh, original ideas, obsess over craft, and want to create work people actually talk about, this role is for you.



You will report to our Creative Director of Co\-Marketing and Ads, Chris Allick, within Superette.


**You're excited about this opportunity because you will…**
-----------------------------------------------------------


* Work on projects that feel worthy of a top place in your portfolio.
* Have a lot of autonomy to run projects and grow as a leader.
* Develop campaigns with the best partners in the industry, who are all eager to work for DoorDash and help shape our brand.
* No new business pitches. No timesheets.
* Dive deep into the brand to create work that not only reaches the highest creative bar but also drives meaningful results.
* Experience a different approach to work compared to traditional advertising agencies.
* Go beyond, making ads to create experiences, content, product enhancements, and solutions that solve our audiences' real problems.
* Work at an intense pace during your day, but will have a good work/life balance
* Collaborate with a team of talented writers, art directors, designers, and social strategists who deeply understand our business and audiences.
* Fully\-remote (within the US)

**We're excited about you because…**
------------------------------------


* You've got a portfolio full of smart, well\-crafted, famous work that broke into culture.
* Proven track record in creating and leading high\-impact, award\-winning campaigns that drive brand recognition and love
* You've done TV/film that you're proud of, but you're mostly excited about big ideas regardless of the medium they live in – whether that is clever activations, social content, brand entertainment, or anything else that earns free media.
* You're amazing at your craft—an exceptional art director with a sharp eye and obsessive attention to detail. Whether it's building decks, scouting a DP, or crafting the visual identity for a campaign, you don't stop until everything is pixel\-perfect.
* Ability to push creative boundaries while maintaining high production standards and a consistent brand aesthetic.
* You're an ad nerd.
* You're proactive by nature — you don't wait to be asked, you spot opportunities and make things happen.
* You embrace change. What worked yesterday might not work today — you stay curious, adapt fast, and keep up with new tools, platforms, and creative possibilities.
* You stay on top of cultural trends, always trying to find the sweet spot where a brand connects with people's lives and interests.
* You're passionate about sports, or entertainment, or pop culture, or all of them combined.
* You don't work in isolation—you love collaborating with people from all departments in the organization.
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience

  

  

We expect this position to be filled by 3/31/26

**About DoorDash**
------------------



At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly, learn, and reiterate in order to make impactful decisions that display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to merchant partners to consumers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door\-to\-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods.
  

  

DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We're committed to supporting employees' happiness, healthiness, and overall well\-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.


**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
---------------------------------------------



We're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That's why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.



Statement of Non\-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on "protected categories," we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce – people who identify as women, non\-binary or gender non\-conforming, LGBTQIA\+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently\-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non\-discrimination.



Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.


**If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.**
company_description: When you join our team, you join our dream: to grow and empower local economies.

title: Sr. Manager, SEO
description:
**Reporting to: Director, Ecommerce**
=====================================

**Job Description:**
--------------------


Lumens is hiring a Sr. Manager, SEO to drive growth in our SEO program and lead a small team of passionate marketers. Optimizing organic traffic and revenue has always been core to our marketing strategy, and all levels of the company are vested in the success of SEO.


The Sr. Manager, SEO is a key leader on the eCommerce team and will shape our future SEO/AIO strategy across technical SEO, content, and backlinking initiatives. This role will develop a program that drives growth in organic revenue and ensures Lumens is recognized as a leader and authority in our space. This data\-driven and analytical SEO leader will establish targets for key SEO \& AIO metrics, and measure performance improvements against those targets.

**Responsibilities:**
---------------------

* Meet or exceed revenue and growth goals
* Define and align SEO/AIO strategy across Marketing, Merchandising, Product, Technology, and Site Experience teams
* Lead the Technical SEO/AIO roadmap planning process, converting strategies into a single product delivery roadmap that is aligned with program goals.
* Develop and communicate detailed Technical SEO business requirements
* Research SEO/AIO best practices and Google algorithm updates to understand the implications of site projects; partner with the Product and Technology teams to communicate SEO best practices for web development; participate in the site release process to QA projects in the releases for SEO compatibility
* Develop onsite product and content optimization plans with the Brand and Site teams
* Lead, develop and measure the SEO/AIO content strategy
* Lead, manage and develop a small team
* Create a focused backlinking strategy and execution plan to obtain high quality backlinks from high domain authority sites.
* Own SEO/AIO related tools, and constantly leverage to monitor SEO\-related issues, performance, and program opportunities
* Establish targets for key SEO/AIO metrics, measure performance improvements against those targets; develop monthly reporting to show progress against goals
* Responsible for team career development and morale
* Inform company of industry updates; be proactive in SEO/AIO research and engage with SEO blogs / forums to keep ahead of the curve and up to date on industry changes.
**Core Characteristics:**
-------------------------

* Ability to develop SEO/AIO strategy, break down to achievable tasks/projects, set goals, regularly measure progress against goals, and reprioritize as needed
* Results oriented with a growth mindset
* Strong organizational skills
* Capable of working across multiple software applications and projects (eg., SEMrush, Botify, GSC, AirOps)
* Takes initiative; is resourceful in finding solutions
* Impactful and able to influence and drive tech prioritization
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Comfortable in a dynamic, growing company environment
* A personal interest in modern design, furniture and home furnishings is encouraged
**Qualifications****:**
-----------------------

* 8\+ years of SEO experience, within e\-commerce / retail space
* Demonstrated strength in analytical abilities
* Team management experience
* Experience in working cross\-functionally effectively in a mid\-size organization
**Location:**
-------------


Willingness to work out of the corporate office located in San Francisco / Sacramento (with some work from home flexibility).

**Compensation:**
-----------------

* $120,000 to $140,000 annually \+ bonus
* Benefits: access to health benefits \+ 401k \+ 3 weeks annual paid time off
**About Lumens:**
-----------------


As North America’s premier destination for design aficionados, architects, interior designers, and contract professionals, Lumens offers a discerning edit of modern lighting, furniture, and décor. Sourcing more than 400 of the most exceptional international design brands, our curated product assortment features iconic designs as well as the latest in contemporary interior decor. Our team includes certified interior designers and ALA\-certified product specialists, and we’re looking for fellow design enthusiasts to join us.


Since June 2021, Lumens has been part of Flos B\&B Italia Group, a leading global high\-end design group operating a portfolio of legacy brands in the world of luxury furnishings and lighting. Driven by a purpose of “We design for a beautiful life,” the Group includes some of the most distinctive European cultural heritage products and designs for the planet, people, and culture. The Group includes FLOS, B\&B Italia, Louis Poulsen, Maxalto, Arclinea, Azucena, FENDI Casa, Audo Copenhagen, and Lumens.

**Commitments:**
----------------


People are at the heart of our business. We strive for an empowering and positive culture and working environment for our people. Therefore, creating a strong, diverse and inclusive team is essential for Lumens. For us, your expertise and motivation matter most.


Lumens is also committed to reducing our environmental impact and preserving our planet. We support brands and products with sustainability attributes at their heart, and we are harnessing our scale and ethos of innovation to bring customers services and solutions that respect the environment. For our employees, our initiatives include green campuses and flexible working to reduce our carbon footprint.

title: Senior Product Designer, Ad Experiences & Solutions
description:
Position Summary
About the Team  

  

Samsung Ads, a division of Samsung Electronics America, powers innovative and data\-driven advertising experiences across Samsung’s ecosystem of devices, including TV, phones, and connected devices. We create tools and experiences that connect brands with consumers, delivering value to both.  

  

The Ad Experiences \& Solutions Design team works closely with product managers, researchers, and engineers to conceptualize, design, and build high\-quality product experiences. The team drives the future of advertising on Samsung devices, which reach millions of users worldwide.  

  

About the Role  

  

As a Senior Product Designer on the Ad Experiences team, you will lead the design of new ad products and optimize existing ones, keeping Samsung’s offerings innovative and competitive with the rest of the industry. You will work directly with product managers, UX researchers, and engineers to translate business and user needs into impactful products and solutions. This role requires a holistic understanding of the advertising ecosystem and strong partnership with global platform teams.  

  

Note: This role requires 5 days in office.  

Location: Mountain View, CA (Preferred) or Los Angeles, CA or New York, NY
Role and Responsibilities
Responsibilities* Lead design initiatives: independently own large\-scale projects from concept to launch, including strategic ideation, detailed flows, wireframes, visuals, and specifications.
* Set the quality bar: deliver best\-in\-class product experiences across multiple platforms, focusing on simplicity, cohesion, and innovation
* Leverage and extend design systems: effectively apply and evolve existing design systems to create cohesive, scalable user experiences across products, ensuring consistency in visual language and interaction patterns
* Collaborate cross\-functionally: work closely with product managers, engineers, researchers, marketers and other designers to define problems and deliver polished product solutions
* Influence global platform teams: drive consensus across partner teams \- such as Home, Gaming, and Digital Appliances through exploratory design and clear communication
* Practice user\-centered design: deeply understand the needs of our customers and advertisers through participation in industry forums, user research, and usability testing. Incorporate insights into design decisions
* Design citizenship: elevate the Design culture through collaboration, peer mentorship, and thoughtful feedback  

Minimum qualifications
* 8\+ years of experience in Design (UI, UX, Product), including experience designing consumer\-facing products
* A strong portfolio demonstrating user\-centered design processes, strategic problem solving skills, and a high level of craft
* Demonstrated ability to partner with cross\-functional stakeholders to define long term product strategy and address immediate tactical needs
* Solid understanding of accessibility and design systems
* Excellent communication, collaboration, time management and organizational skills


Skills and Qualifications
Nice to Have* Experience in ad\-tech, CTV, or related industry
* Experience with multi\-language products
* Experience running user research sessions
* Familiarity with AI\-enhanced user experiences or contextual design patterns
* Motion / interaction prototyping skills and experience working with engineers to bring motion\-rich designs to life  

  

CALIFORNIA ONLY Compensation for this role is expected to be between $185,000 and $215,000\. Actual pay will be determined considering factors such as relevant skills and experience, and comparison to other employees in the role. Regular full\-time employees (salaried or hourly) have access to benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401(k), Employee Purchase Program, Tuition Assistance (after 6 months), Paid Time Off, Student Loan Program (after 6 months), Wellness Incentives, and many more.  

  

\#LI\-SM

  

At Samsung, we believe that innovation and growth are driven by an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. We aim to create a global team where everyone belongs and has equal opportunities, inspiring our talent to be their true selves. Together, we are building a better tomorrow for our customers, partners, and communities.* Samsung Electronics America, Inc. and its subsidiaries are committed to employing a diverse workforce, and provide Equal Employment Opportunity for all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a protected veteran, genetic information, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.


Reasonable Accommodations for Qualified Individuals with Disabilities During the Application Process
Samsung Electronics America is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you have a disability and require a reasonable accommodation in order to participate in the application process, please contact our Reasonable Accommodation Team (855\-557\-3247\) or SEA\_Accommodations\_Ext@sea.samsung.com for assistance. This number is for accommodation requests only and is not intended for general employment inquiries.

title: Senior Industrial Designer
description:
MOUNTAIN VIEW, CALIFORNIA, UNITED STATES


FULL\-TIME


DESIGN


4283


  
Add to favorites
 View favorites

Waymo is an autonomous driving technology company with the mission to be the world's most trusted driver. Since its start as the Google Self\-Driving Car Project in 2009, Waymo has focused on building the Waymo Driver—The World's Most Experienced Driver™—to improve access to mobility while saving thousands of lives now lost to traffic crashes. The Waymo Driver powers Waymo’s fully autonomous ride\-hail service and can also be applied to a range of vehicle platforms and product use cases. The Waymo Driver has provided over ten million rider\-only trips, enabled by its experience autonomously driving over 100 million miles on public roads and tens of billions in simulation across 15\+ U.S. states.


Passionate about aesthetics and product innovation, Waymo’s Industrial Design Team is responsible for envisioning the future of mobility and autonomous driving technology. The Design Team develops and applies cohesive design language to the Waymo Driver, delivering an exceptional customer experience with best\-in\-class product quality.
  

  

The Industrial Design Team creates smart and elegant solutions that pave the future of mobility while prioritizing our riders’ needs \& safety. We are involved in every step of the engineering and product development process to optimize Waymo’s technology and delight the rider’s journey. The team is a unique fusion of creatives and innovators with the opportunity to pioneer a new industry.


*This role follows a hybrid work schedule and you will report to Head of Industrial Design.*

  


**You will:**


* Lead the full industrial design process from initial concept and research through to production, defining scope, strategy, and execution plans driving innovative hardware solutions. Work with external partners to negotiate and co\-develop designs
* Partner closely with Product Management, Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical), UX Research, and Operations teams to translate complex user needs and technical requirements into tangible, user\-centric hardware and experiences
* Develop and communicate production\-intent design concepts through a high\-fidelity process, including 2D sketching, 3D CAD modeling, and creating both digital and physical prototypes
* Collaborate with internal teams and external vendors to oversee the transition from design to manufacturing, ensuring design intent, quality, and CMF (Color, Materials, Finish) are maintained in the final product
* Help define and champion the physical product and hardware strategy, ensuring it aligns with the overall Waymo brand and user experience goals


**You have:**


* 5\+ years of professional industrial design experience, specifically within automotive (OEM or Supplier) environments
* A proven history of shipping complex products from concept to mass production, demonstrating deep knowledge of manufacturing processes, materials, and CMF
* Exceptional 2D and 3D design skills, with mastery of sketching, digital rendering, 3D CAD (e.g. Alias, SolidWorks, Rhino), and rapid prototyping techniques
* Strong visual and verbal communication skills, with experience presenting compelling design narratives and collaborating with cross\-functional teams to align on strategy
* A strong portfolio of work demonstrating exceptional design\-thinking, problem\-solving, and a meticulous attention to detail and craft. The portfolio should showcase broad exploration and understanding of vehicle designs
* A degree in Industrial Design, Transportation or a related field, or equivalent practical experience


**We prefer:**


* Experience designing for complex hardware systems, robotics, or products with a high degree of technical integration
* Experience helping to create or work within a physical design language that scales across a hardware portfolio


**Travel Requirements:**


* 1\-2 times per quarter


The expected base salary range for this full\-time position across US locations is listed below. Actual starting pay will be based on job\-related factors, including exact work location, experience, relevant training and education, and skill level. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the role location or, if the role can be performed remote, the specific salary range for your preferred location, during the hiring process.



Waymo employees are also eligible to participate in Waymo’s discretionary annual bonus program, equity incentive plan, and generous Company benefits program, subject to eligibility requirements.



Salary Range
$196,000—$248,000 USD

title: Staff Design Systems Designer
location: San Francisco Bay Area, CA, US
description:
### **About Ethos**



Ethos was built to make it faster and easier to get life insurance for the next million families. Our approach blends industry expertise, technology, and the human touch to find you the right policy to protect your loved ones.



We leverage deep technology and data science to streamline the life insurance process, making it more accessible and convenient. Using predictive analytics, we are able to transform a traditionally multi\-week process into a modern digital experience for our users that can take just minutes! We've issued billions in coverage each month and eliminated the traditional barriers, ushering the industry into the modern age. Our full\-stack technology platform is the backbone of family financial health.



We make getting life insurance easier, faster and better for everyone.



Our investors include General Catalyst, Sequoia Capital, Accel Partners, Google Ventures, SoftBank, and the investment vehicles of Jay\-Z, Kevin Durant, Robert Downey Jr and others. This year, we were named on CB Insights' Global Insurtech 50 list and BuiltIn's Top 100 Midsize Companies in San Francisco. We are scaling quickly and looking for passionate people to protect the next million families!

### **Design at Ethos**



Design at Ethos plays a meaningful role in shaping our product and customer experience end\-to\-end. We work cross\-functionally to solve hard problems, build products that matter, and raise the bar for craft in a highly regulated, decision\-heavy domain. You'll experiment, learn quickly, and help us build a stronger design practice as we grow.


### **About the Role**



We're looking for Ethos' first Design Systems Designer to build and evolve the design system that powers our customer and internal experiences.



This is a true 01 opportunity. Ethos is not yet "design\-system mature," and that's exactly why this role matters: you'll help bring structure to how we design and build UI, without slowing down product teams or over\-engineering processes. You'll partner closely with Product Design, Engineering, Brand/Creative, and Content Design to create a system that helps teams move faster while improving consistency, accessibility, quality, and trust.



This role is a blend of strategy and hands\-on execution. You'll define what the system is, build it in Figma, help translate it into production\-ready components and tokens with engineering, and set the operating model that keeps it healthy as Ethos scales into its next chapter.


### **Duties and Responsibilities:**


#### **Strategy \& Foundations**


* Establish the vision, principles, and roadmap for Ethos' design system — balancing long\-term scalability with near\-term product needs.
* Audit the current system, product UI and identify the highest\-leverage opportunities to standardize patterns and reduce inconsistency.
* Define a scalable token strategy (color, typography, spacing, elevation, motion, etc.) and a clear approach to theming and brand expression across products.

#### **System Design \& Craft**


* Design, build, and maintain Figma libraries (components, styles/variables, templates, and patterns) that product teams can confidently use.
* Create high\-quality component specifications with clear interaction behavior, states, responsive guidance, and accessibility considerations (focus, keyboard, contrast, error handling, etc.).
* Ensure the system supports narrative, conversion\-driven experiences (e.g., discovery flows, applications, underwriting moments, onboarding, policy management, lifecycle touchpoints).

#### **Engineering Partnership**


* Partner with Design System / Front\-End engineers to translate the system into reusable code components and tokens (and help define component APIs that work for product teams).
* Align on workflows that keep design and code in sync (component lifecycle, versioning, release notes, deprecations).
* Drive pragmatic adoption: start where it matters most, ship iteratively, and build credibility through visible product impact.

#### **Governance, Adoption \& Enablement**


* Build documentation that is actually used: guidelines, do/don't examples, usage rationale, and decision records.
* Coach and enable partner teams (Product Design, Engineering, PM) on how to use the system effectively and when to extend it.
* Create a lightweight contribution process that enables product designers and engineers to propose, review, and add to the system.

#### **Measurement \& Iteration**


* Define what success looks like and track meaningful signals (adoption, UI consistency, reduced design/development time, accessibility improvements, fewer regressions).
* Partner with Research and Data teams where useful to connect system changes to outcomes (quality, user confidence, conversion efficiency).

### **Qualifications and Skills:**


* 7\+ years of relevant experience, with a track record of setting system strategy, driving cross\-team adoption, and raising the bar for design quality across an organization.
* Strong product design foundation with excellent visual and interaction craft — you care deeply about details and can scale that quality through systems.
* Hands\-on experience building and maintaining design systems in Figma, including component architecture, documentation, and scalable patterns.
* Strong working fluency with modern front\-end concepts (tokens, components, states, responsive behavior). You don't need to be an engineer, but you can collaborate closely with engineering and understand tradeoffs.
* Experience setting accessibility standards and shipping accessible components (WCAG\-informed practices, inclusive design thinking).
* Ability to thrive in ambiguity and build structure where it doesn't yet exist — you're pragmatic, opinionated, and iterative.
* Clear communicator who can align diverse stakeholders and influence without relying on formal authority.
* A portfolio that demonstrates end\-to\-end design system thinking and real\-world impact (adoption, quality, speed, consistency).
* Experience building design tokens pipelines and/or working with tooling like Storybook or similar component documentation environments preferred.
* Experience with video, motion, illustration/iconography, tone preferred.


**\#****LI\-Remote \#LI\-JA1**



The US national base salary range for this full\-time position is $126,000 \- $224,000\. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job\-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.



Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only and do not include applicable bonus, equity, or benefits.



You can find further details of our US benefits at https://www.ethoslife.com/careers/


Don't meet every single requirement? If you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. At Ethos we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace.



We are an equal opportunity employer who values diversity and inclusion and look for applicants who understand, embrace and thrive in a multicultural world. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the SF Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider employment for qualified applicants with arrests and conviction records.



To learn more about what information we collect and how it may be used, please refer to our California Candidate Privacy Notice.


***Recruitment Notice: Please be aware of recruitment scams. All legitimate communication from our team will only come from email addresses ending in @ethos.com or @getethos.com.***  

***We will never ask for payment, banking details, or sensitive personal information during the hiring process. If you are contacted by someone claiming to represent us from a different email address, please treat it as fraudulent.***
company_description: Ethos is a technology company making life insurance easier, faster, and better for everyone. We leverage deep technology and data science in our mission to protect the next million families.

title: Sr. Design Researcher, Mobile Design
description:
**Job Description**

**About the team:**

GM’s Human Interface Design Studio is hiring a Senior Design Researcher to Partner with our mobile design team to proactively determine research needs and prioritize work that informs the understanding of user needs and provides tactical design insights. As part of our team, you’ll collaborate with design, product, engineering, brand, and marketing teams to craft well designed research initiatives to inspire and inform user centered designs.


**What You’ll Do**

As a Senior Design Researcher, you will conduct research to help support our strategic vision. While working with cross\-functional teams, you will develop a shared plan to address research goals. This includes close collaboration with partners, facilitating conversations, secondary research, and generative and evaluative research using both qualitative and quantitative methods. You will use your great strengths in storytelling to share your research point of view in a compelling, convincing manner to the broader team.


**Key Characteristics**

* A demonstrated track record owning and leading design research, working cross\-functionally and thinking strategically to inform research for one or more broad or complex product areas.
* A strong working knowledge and extensive experience of multiple generative and evaluative research methods, how to apply them in a fast\-moving organization, and experience mentoring or coaching other researchers on the use of these methods.
* The ability to translate insight into action. You help teams understand customer needs, attitudes, and behaviors through thoughtful and actionable research. Your work informs both strategic and tactical efforts.
* Knowledge of the product design process and experience collaborating with other researchers, designers, content strategists, product managers, and engineers to help transform complex problems into easy\-to\-use products. You recommend how to best address our research goals and questions, so your partners don’t have to.
* The ability to translate research findings into product priorities and strategic narratives, new business opportunities, within and across different projects.
* Adaptability and a growth\-mindset, seeking out and welcoming feedback from senior leaders and managers.
* Ability to produce great work in short timeframes, multi\-task across different projects and platforms and adapt to the ever\-changing priorities of the business.

**Responsibilities**

* Design and field mixed methods research studies including live studies, un\-moderated studies, field studies, participatory design, heuristic evaluations, and remote usability testing to inform and inspire product and design decisions.
* Assist the mobile team in proactively determining research needs, working closely with the team to prioritize work that will help to support them team.
* Enhance your work by actively seeking out research and metrics from internal and external sources to provide comprehensive recommendations that inform design and business strategy.
* Collaborate seamlessly and flexibly with cross\-functional partners to drive best\-in\-class thinking from all parts of the organization.
* Work quickly and efficiently without sacrificing quality and knowing how to adapt to the ever\-changing priorities of the web and app experiences.
* Work on multiple projects concurrently in a very fast paced environment, ensuring that quality deliverables are achieved on time.
* Stay up\-to\-date with the latest industry news and developments.
* Contribute to the continued evolution of the team’s workflows and processes to further improve quality and performance.
* Have exceptional communication \& presentation skills, both written and verbal.

**Qualifications**

* 5 or more years executing user research to inform interactive product design required.
* Strong portfolio with work samples showcasing expertise in user research required.
* Excellent written, visual, and verbal communication skills.
* Knowledge of design thinking methods.
* Familiarity with common design user experience research tools (e.g., dScout, Optimal Workshop, Qualtrics, User Testing, and Figma).
* Familiarity with data science practices and working closely with data scientists/analysts in the design space (A/B testing, data analysis, etc.).
* Proficient in multiple user research methodologies is required (contextual inquiry, empathy interviews, ethnography/observational research, heuristic evaluation and expert reviews, usability testing; surveys, card sorting/tree testing \- information architecture, focus groups, competitive evaluation, SUS testing).
* Proficient in all aspects of study planning/fielding/analysis/synthesis/socialization of key findings (i.e., team consultation, recruiting, methodology and metrics development, analysis, reporting results, socialization of key findings, etc.) required.
* Experience with consumer apps preferred.
* Ability to work collaboratively required.
* Automotive experience strongly preferred.

**Compensation**

The compensation information is a good faith estimate only. It is based on what a successful applicant might be paid in accordance with applicable state laws. The compensation may not be representative for positions located outside of New York, Colorado, California, or Washington.


* The salary range for this role is: ($124,200 \- $165,300\). The actual base salary a successful candidate will be offered within this range will vary based on factors relevant to the position.
* Bonus Potential: An incentive pay program offers payouts based on company performance, job level, and individual performance.
* Benefits: GM offers a variety of health and wellbeing benefit programs. Benefit options include medical, dental, vision, Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Accounts, retirement savings plan, sickness and accident benefits, life insurance, paid vacation \& holidays, tuition assistance programs, employee assistance program, GM vehicle discounts and more.

\&\#xa;\&\#xa;\&\#xa;\&\#xa;
**About GM**

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.


**Why Join Us**

We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Every day, we want every employee to feel they belong to one General Motors team.


**Benefits Overview**

From day one, we're looking out for your well\-being–at work and at home–so you can focus on realizing your ambitions. Learn how GM supports a rewarding career that rewards you personally by visiting **Total Rewards resources** .


**Non\-Discrimination and Equal Employment Opportunities (U.S.)**

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of unlawful discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that providing an inclusive workplace creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers.


All employment decisions are made on a non\-discriminatory basis without regard to sex, race, color, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, disability, pregnancy or maternity status, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran or protected veteran, or any other similarly protected status in accordance with federal, state and local laws.


We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications for each role and apply for any positions that match their skills and capabilities. Applicants in the recruitment process may be required, where applicable, to successfully complete a role\-related assessment(s) and/or a pre\-employment screening prior to beginning employment. To learn more, visit **How we Hire** .


**Accommodations**

General Motors offers opportunities to all job seekers including individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, **email** us or call us at 800\-865\-7580\. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.
